result.execSummary:
The defendant Cameron J. Riyahi Mehabadi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Provide a DNA sample. 
Same conditions of probation as imposed in Count 3.

timeConds.notes: Huber for going to work and counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.

supervisions.notes: ***NO JAIL CREDIT ON THIS COUNT ONLY!

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse Surcharge.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
No contact with his father Hossein Riyahi-Mehabadi or his sisters Katie Riyahi-Mehabadi and Ashley Miener.  Court will allow contact with his father Hossein Riyahi-Mehabadi or his sisters Katie Riyahi-Mehabadi and Ashley Miener if they request and agent approves.

Provide agent with medical releases so the agent can monitor compliance with any prescription medications prescribed and medical releases to check with the pharmacy. 
Only use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions. 
Complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program if recommended by the agent. 
Participate in any other counseling recommendations.
Write a letter of apology to his father.
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Per Restitution order /s/TBE: Restitution due of $2,633.04.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cameron J. Riyahi Mehabadi in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Cameron J. Riyahi Mehabadi in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:46 am.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Counts 1 & 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 

Victim is present and makes a statement to the Court. 
Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Wallace makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 3 - 
60 days jail, - STAYED - (No jail credit on this count)
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years:
Obtain AODA and comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Obtain mental health assessment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Provide agent with medical releases so the agent can monitor compliance with any prescription medications prescribed and medical releases to check with the pharmacy.
Only use 1 pharmacy to obtain prescriptions. 
No contact with his father or his sister Katie and Ashley Minor. 
Complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program if recommended by the agent.
Maintain fulltime employment.
Participate in any other counseling recommendations.
Not possess any dangerous weapons.
Write a letter of apology to his father. 
Court will allow contact with his father and sister Katie and Ashley Minor if they request and agent approves. 
Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse surcharge. 

Count 1 - 
4 1/2 years prison with 2 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision - STAYED -
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years: 
Pay fine of $500 plus costs including the DNA surcharge and Domestic Abuse Surcharge. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
Serve 10 months in the county jail with credit for 136 days. 
Huber for going to work and counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.
Same conditions of probation as imposed in Count 3. 
Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Programs.
Plea hearing on February 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 2, 2015 at 11:30 am.
for Bond Hearing
from Judge re: exparte communication
Pre-trial conference on December 1, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Cameron J. Riyahi Mehabadi in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Cameron J. Riyahi Mehabadi in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Atty Wallace makes arguments in regards to bond. 
Atty Molepske makes arguments. 
Atty Wallace makes additional statements. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court will not amend the bond.  Motion is denied.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Cameron J. Riyahi Mehabadi appeared by video with John Wallace appearing by video as well. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Wallace

Surrender passport.
Not leave the state of Wisconsin
No contact, direct/indirect with his father.  This is a condition of confinement as well.
No contact, direct/indirect with Katie or Ashley.  This is a condition of confinement as well. 
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *7 times per week

DA Louis Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

DA Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of Strangulation/Suffocation, Substantial Battery.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 

State requests a $50,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  10/06/14  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
